column1:
By default prices are shown incl. Tax so only change this option if necessary.
If the feed export is without tax it's possible to add it with this option.
column2:
By default prices are shown incl. Tax so only change this option if necessary.

column1: Each store view will have their own Google Shopping feed, you can easily activate or de-activate the Google Shopping feed generation on store level or automatically generate the Google Shopping feed. In case your not using the cron job functionality it's possible to generate the Google Shopping feed manually.
column2: Each store view will have their own Google Shopping feed, you can easily activate or de-activate the Google Shopping feed generation on store level or automatically generate the Google Shopping feed. In case your not using the cron job functionality it's possible to generate the Google Shopping feed manually.

column1: Extention needs to be enabled to use this function
column2: Extension needs to be enabled to use this function

column1:
Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. While Google can't guarantee that a product will show in a particular category, you can increase the chances that your products will be included in the most relevant categories by sending them highly structured information for your items.
Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy inlcuding the different categories.
column2:
Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. While Google can't guarantee that a product will show in a particular category, you can increase the chances that your products will be included in the most relevant categories by sending them highly structured information for your items.
Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy inlcuding the different categories.

column1:
Required according to the Unique Product Identifier Rules for all target countries except for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. This attribute is recommended for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey.
Note: Don't provide your store name as the brand unless you manufacture the product.
column2:
Required according to the Unique Product Identifier Rules for all target countries except for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. This attribute is recommended for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey.
Note: Don't provide your store name as the brand unless you manufacture the product.

column1: Set limit for testing, use 0 for all products
column2: Set limit for testing, use 0 for all products

column1: The Manufacturer Part Number is used to reference and identify a product using a manufacturer specific naming other than GTIN. MPNs are assigned by a manufacturer. MPNs should typically be specific to a single unique product. For example, different colors of a product should have different MPNs.
column2: The Manufacturer Part Number is used to reference and identify a product using a manufacturer specific naming other than GTIN. MPNs are assigned by a manufacturer. MPNs should typically be specific to a single unique product. For example, different colors of a product should have different MPNs.

column1: The condition is an required field for the feed. Only three options are available: New, Refurbished & Used. Please select the default condition of your products, when you change the condition on product-level in the Google Shopping Tab the product-condition will be overwritten.
column2: The condition is an required field for the feed. Only three options are available: New, Refurbished & Used. Please select the default condition of your products, when you change the condition on product-level in the Google Shopping Tab the product-condition will be overwritten.

column1: This option allows you to exclude product from the Google Shopping Feed. To exclude certain products from the Google Shopping feed you easily select yes in the Google Shopping tab on your product configuration page.
column2: This option allows you to exclude product from the Google Shopping Feed. To exclude certain products from the Google Shopping feed you easily select yes in the Google Shopping tab on your product configuration page.

column1: This section lists all the available attributes for the Google Shopping Feed. Some attributes are required for all products and some are required for certain product types such as apparel, others are recommended. To avoid errors in the Google Shopping feed please make sure that you provide  all recommended attributes.
column2: This section lists all the available attributes for the Google Shopping Feed. Some attributes are required for all products and some are required for certain product types such as apparel, others are recommended. To avoid errors in the Google Shopping feed please make sure that you provide  all recommended attributes.

column1: Use the GTIN/Barcode attribute to submit Global Trade Item Numbers (GTINs) in one of the following formats: UPC (in North America), EAN (in Europe), JAN (in Japan) or ISBN (for books). Please select the attribute that provide these GTINs (for eg. SKU).
column2: Use the GTIN/Barcode attribute to submit Global Trade Item Numbers (GTINs) in one of the following formats: UPC (in North America), EAN (in Europe), JAN (in Japan) or ISBN (for books). Please select the attribute that provide these GTINs (for eg. SKU).

column1: When the tax percentage is 21% use 21.
column2: When the tax percentage is 21% use 21.
